faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Foreign nationals enjoy unrestricted property purchase rights in Spain, identical to Spanish citizens. No special permits or restrictions apply, though professional legal guidance ensures compliance with acquisition procedures, tax obligations, and documentation requirements. Our experienced team facilitates the entire process for international clients, managing NIE applications, notarial arrangements, and registration procedures seamlessly.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Beyond purchase price, typical acquisition costs include: transfer tax (6-8% depending on region), notary fees (0.8-1%), property registration fees (0.5-1%), and legal representation (1-2%). Total closing costs typically range 8-12% of purchase price. Annual ownership costs include property tax (0.4-1.1%), home insurance (0.3-0.5%), and community fees if applicable. Our team provides detailed cost projections during the acquisition process.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers exceptional value relative to Northern Europe. Monthly expenses for comfortable living typically range €1,500-2,500 including rent/mortgage, utilities, groceries, and dining—substantially below equivalent UK or Northern European standards. Healthcare, education, and transportation remain particularly affordable. Yecla specifically offers 15-20% lower costs compared to coastal tourist-oriented areas, enabling sophisticated lifestyle at remarkable value.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle adaptée aux retraités ?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca attracts thousands of retirees annually due to: year-round warm Mediterranean climate, affordable healthcare with English-speaking physicians, established retirement communities, favorable tax conditions, low cost of living, and extensive social infrastructure. Yecla specifically offers peaceful living without tourist congestion, making it particularly appealing for those seeking authentic Spanish culture alongside international community support.

faqs.question: Ai-je besoin d'un visa pour acheter un bien en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: No. Property purchase does not require visa sponsorship for foreign nationals. However, establishing Spanish residency involves separate procedures: Non-Lucrative Visa requires €27,792 annual income proof; Digital Nomad Visa targets remote workers; Golden Visa available through property investment exceeding €500,000. Residency enables banking, tax optimization, and healthcare access—our team advises on appropriate visa options aligned with individual circumstances.

faqs.question: Combien coûtent les taxes foncières en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Spain employs multiple property-related taxes: Annual property tax (IBI) ranges 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value; wealth tax (for non-residents) applies 0.2-3.75% depending on asset values; rental income taxed at standard rates (45% marginal). Residents benefit from tax treaty provisions with UK and other nations preventing double taxation. Professional tax optimization minimizes liabilities—our advisors ensure compliance while maximizing legitimate deductions.
